intro: Mallotus xylacanthus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mallot, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It produces woody capsules containing numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Mallotus xylacanthus is often found in lowland and hill forest areas, thriving in humid, shaded environments.
